header.title: BBC's Laura Kuenssberg confronts Lib Dems' Jo Swinson on 'disregarding' 17.4million voters
header.subtitle: BBC News political editor Laura Kuenssberg confronted Jo Swinson over her pledge to bring the country together while promising to disregard  the will of 17.4 million Britons who voted to leave the EU in the 2016 referendum.
header.postText: 'The Liberal Democrat leader launched her party campaign ahead of the December general election pledging once again to cancel Brexit should her party win a governing majority. But as she also promised to unite the country, BBC's Laura Kuenssberg challenged the Remain leader on how she would reconcile with the 17.4 million Britons who voted for Brexit in the 2016 referendum and will feel disregarded  by a Lib Dem government.', 'Ms Kuenssberg asked: You said this morning you want to bring the country together.', 'But how would you do that if your plan is to disregard the vote of millions of people in the referendum of 2016?', 'Whether that’s campaigning to stop Brexit in another referendum or if you achieve your dream of a majority, revoking it all together without even having another vote?', 'The Lib Dem leader replied: As Liberal Democrats, we are standing up for what we believe in and we are very honest and straightforward about that.', 'I recognise that there are differences of opinion on this issue and I think people recognise and appreciate that we are consistent and we are firm in what we are standing for.', 'I think it’s also true that there is very little reason to have confidence that there is a majority in this country for any specific Brexit path.', 'Theresa May’s Brexit wasn’t acceptable to Boris Johnson.', 'Boris Johnson’s Brexit isn’t acceptable to Nigel Farage. There isn’t a Brexit that commands a majority.', 'We want to stop Brexit and if we get a majority Liberal Democrat government that is exactly what we will do.', 'And we have led the campaign for a People’s Vote which would put a specific Brexit deal to the public and say these are the details.', 'This is what has been negotiated, do you want to go ahead with that specific Brexit deal?', 'And I believe in those circumstances people would vote Remain because I don’t think there is a majority for any specific Brexit.', 'Speaking in Westminster, Ms Swinson, who courted controversy on Monday for suggesting those refusing to debate her in TV leadership hustings were sexist, said the election could be a moment of seismic change where a new and different politics could emerge.', 'She told the audience: Change is possible and you get to choose.', 'Ms Swinson also claimed staying in the EU would produce a £50billion Remain bonus that could be spent on public services.', 'She said: Any type of Brexit will damage our economy, will cost jobs and starve our public services of the resources that they need. ', ' So we know that that Remain bonus will be £50billion that we can spend on our public services, investing in our schools and in the welfare system to help the poorest in our society.', 'So every vote for the Liberal Democrats is a vote to stop Brexit and invest that£ 50 billion in our public services.'

replies.commentText: It's the only 'Brexit' that IS 'Brexit'.

There is absolutely no majority for a clean break Brexit. Only in Nigel Farage's head! He has done an amazing job and has been very successful, but he is currently sounding a bit deluded. 20 of his candidates have already quit. He isn't even standing. The facts are these: He won't get 12 MPs. The Lib Dems will easily get 12 more than they currently have. The SNP will get far more than they currently have. At least half the Conservative Party will never vote for a no deal Brexit and only the BP MPs would vote for it, so it will never pass. The only relevance that the BP have is to field candidates in former Labour seats, where the electorate won't vote Labour now. Doing anything that affects Boris getting a large majority will just let Corbyn in, definitely propped up by the SNP and maybe the Lib Dems too, although he probably won't need them.

commentThread.commentText: People are changing thier minds on Brexit because they realise the impact that Brexit will have on their jobs and livlihoods. For example, people working in the car industry. Farmers, especially smaller farmers. Fishermen reliant on access to EU waters, such as many fishermen in the west and south 18 % of the UK catch is from EU waters, but this is concenrrated in particular areas People want a chance to change their minds, now they have all the facts.

replies.commentText: On what planet would that be Vaughan? Another sore loser obviously!!

@Vaughan..... What are you talking about ? ie fishermen reliant on access to EU waters !!!!!! They are NOT EU waters. Don't you realise that the EU are over using OUR waters, and our fishermen have been forced by the EU to literally burn their boats while watching other nations come into OUR waters and take OUR fishstocks. The EU have bribed car manufactuers with eu loans and handouts to LEAVE Britain and move to other EU countries , because they want to stop OUR success. The EU hounds our farmers, and use drones to watch their fields in case a few extra lambs more than they allow can be counted, then the farmers are fined. These are the FACTS you should be taking into account. The EU is BAD for Britain which ever way you look at it. We need a clean break Brexit.

18% of the UK catch is from waters outside of UK territorial waters, so those fishermen currently reliant on fishing from off the French coast, such as the UK cockle fishermen who were in the news last year because they came to blows with the French, would be in a pickle. There are some factories which have been relocated to other EU countries with EU subsidies, such as the Kraft factory, but generally our larger manufacturers have benefitted from EU membership.BMW and Nissan would probably not be located in the UK if we were not in the EU.So leaving the EU creates a major problem for these fishermen and farmers.
That is your opinion not facts.

What a complete load of old remainer tosh. No one I know has changed their minds on the Evil Union, instead they have strengthened their feelings FOR Brexit. Stop spreading your bile and fear and get behind your country and believe in Britan, for a change.

I suggest you go to the Wikipedia Brexit page where you'll find every single opinion poll on Brexit in a graph over the past few years, plus You Gov polls on a table. It 's well over two years since any poll from any company showed most people still thought Brexit was a good idea, albeit the margins are generally quite small
Go away
Says whom?
Mr. Nobody!
If you go to the Wikipedia Brexit page you'll find every single opinion poll on Brexit on a graph over the past few years, plus You Gov polls on a table.
Load of old drivel, and you KNOW it
Doesn't affect the recorded result, which must be democratically implemented. Move to the DPRK if you don 't like democracy by ballot.
In a democracy, people can and do change their minds.
In YOUR world yes maybe
In a democracy, the ballot box result rules.
Of course, so we now have a chance to express our views via the election. In the unlikely event that the largest vote is for the Lib Dems, there will be a clear mandate to revoke Article 50.

commentThread.commentText: Every poll taken over the past two years shows the majority of the population now think Brexit was a mistake. And if there were a referendum with two options, deal or remain, remain would win quite comfortably. People can and do change their minds.That 's called democracy.
Don't forget, by a small majority women voted remain.

replies.commentText: Don't you have a nursery school you need to get back to?
